speaker: Facebook posts
vclaim: Says image shows Pete Buttigieg in a leather suit posing with two other men.
date: stated on February 8, 2020 in a Facebook post:
title: A doctored image falsely shows Pete Buttigieg in leather suit
text:
A photo shared on Facebook falsely shows Democratic presidential candidate Pete Buttigieg dressed in a black leather suit and standing on the street posing for a picture alongside two other men.
The post was flagged as part of Facebook’s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed. (Read more about our partnership with Facebook.)
PolitiFact ran reverse image searches and found the original photo, which does not include Buttigieg. The picture found on Pinterest does not identify who’s in it; it only says it’s from a Folsom Street Fair.

Featured Fact-check
















Instagram posts


stated on January 12, 2021 in an Instagram post








Says Joe Biden stayed silent about violence at Black Lives Matter protests.












By Tom Kertscher • January 16, 2021







The Facebook photo was edited to replace the face of the person originally in the photo with an image of Buttigieg’s face.
We rate the doctored Facebook photo Pants on Fire!
